item.title: Let's LISP like it's 1959
item.description: Presentation I did at linux.conf.au 2019 about the history of Lisp, computers and programming in general. Got written up as an article on LWN.net to my delight, and so far the comments have generally been surprisingly positive pretty much everywhere. On April 7 (2019), I will be doing an updated version of this talk at FOSS North in Gothenburg - my time slot is 15 minutes longer, so I might actually get through most of the talk this time.

item.title: Everyone gets a pony!
item.description: Presentation I did at linux.conf.au 2018 about the programming language Pony.

item.title: Package Managers #lca2017
item.description: .embed-container { position: relative; padding-bottom: 56.25%; height: 0; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; } .embed-container iframe, .embed-container object, .embed-container embed { position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; } edit: This got written up as an article on LWN.net, a huge thank you to Jonathan Corbet for that! I have also been thinking about this presentation a lot in the years following - the package management problem remains unsolved and it's still something I wrestle with.
